sense.name: pass time in a particular place or way
sense.examples: I spent my vacation in Hawaii. How do animals spend winter? She spends an hour everday in the gym. He spent a lot of time thinking about it.

sense.name: use money, pay
sense.examples: They plan to spend millions of dollars on disabled citizens. How do you spend your allowance? They spend 2 dollars and make one dollar in return.

sense.name: use, devote effort, sacrifice
sense.examples: Stupidly, I spent all my energy trying to make you happy! They spent their their lives working for the reform. He spent his youth in search of knowledge and truth. For those curious as to what I spent a headache over, go here.

sense.name: wear out, exhaust
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1 SPEND [intransitive] NP1 SPEND self
sense.examples: It's been a rough day, and I am completely spent. The storm finally spent itself. I think she spent herself and drover herself crazy.

sense.name: BRITISH IDIOM - go to toilet
sense.examples: Latrine-loving Londoners spend a penny. 'I want to spend a penny,' said Peggy, her face uneasy.
